analysis.osu.std package¶

Submodules¶

analysis.osu.std.map_data module¶

class analysis.osu.std.map_data.StdMapData¶

Bases: object

Class used for navigating, extracting, and operating on map data.

Note

This is not to be confused with the map data in the Beatmap class. Data used by this class is in numpy array form. Data in the Beatmap class is based on *.osu file structure and is not in a friendly format to perform analysis on.

POS = 1¶
TIME = 0¶

Returns: [

[ time, x_pos, y_pos, m1, m2, k1, k2, smoke ], [ time, x_pos, y_pos, m1, m2, k1, k2, smoke ], [ time, x_pos, y_pos, m1, m2, k1, k2, smoke ], … N events

]

A list of events with data on time, positions of cursor, and flags on various key presses

static interpolate_timings(replay_data)¶

Replay data is often eradic with its timings due to sync issues in osu! client dealing with performance. The frames do not occur a constant interval after another, and can range to have between 1ms and 25ms difference.

static order_timings(replay_data)¶

Sometimes replay data has jumps in timing going backwards. This orders replay frames into correct sequence

static press_end_times(replay_data, key=None)¶

Returns: [ press_end_idxs, press_end_times ] = [ [ int, int, … ], [ int, int, … ] ]

Tuple with indices in replay_data where a press ends and timings where press ends. press_end_idxs can be used on original replay_data to get full data related to end times like so: replay_data[press_end_idxs]

static press_start_end_times(replay_data, key=None)¶

Returns: [

[ press_start_idx, press_start_time, press_end_idx, press_end_time ], [ press_start_idx, press_start_time, press_end_idx, press_end_time ], …

]

static press_start_times(replay_data, key=None)¶

Returns: [ press_start_idxs, press_start_times ] = [ [ int, int, … ], [ int, int, … ] ]

Tuple with indices in replay_data where a press ends and timings where press ends. press_start_idxs can be used on original replay_data to get full data related to start times like so: replay_data[press_start_idxs]

static avg_cursor_pos(replay_data_list)¶

Takes all replays and determines average cursor position throughout all points in time Cursor positions are averaged across a moving average of 5 ms

static odds_all_conditions_within(score_data, tap_offset, cursor_offset)¶
static odds_all_cursor_within(score_data, offset)¶
static odds_all_tap_within(score_data, offset)¶
static odds_some_cursor_within(score_data, offset)¶

Creates a 2D gaussian distribution model using avg and var of cursor 2D position offsets and uses it to calculates the odds that some cursor position is within the specified distance from the center of any hitobject

Returns: probability one random value [X, Y] is between (-offset, -offset) <= (X, Y) <= (offset, offset)
TL;DR: look at all the cursor positions for score; What are the odds of you picking a random hit that has

a cursor position between an area of (-offset, -offset) and (offset, offset)?

static odds_some_tap_within(score_data, offset)¶

Creates a gaussian distribution model using avg and var of tap offsets and calculates the odds that some hit is within the specified offset

Returns: probability one random value [X] is between -offset <= X <= offset
TL;DR: look at all the hits for scores; What are the odds of you picking

a random hit that is between -offset and offset?

analysis.osu.std.score_metrics module¶

class analysis.osu.std.score_metrics.StdScoreMetrics¶

Bases: object

Takes arrays of score data pertaining to various players and transposes it to be an array of per-hitobject score data from various players

[

[

a0 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], a2 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], aN … N events

], [

b0 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], b1 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], bN … N events

]

gets turned into

[

[

a0 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], b0 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], N0 … N events

], [

a1 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], b1 [ time, (cursor_pos_x, cursor_pos_y), hit_offset, (pos_offset_x, pos_offset_y), hitobject_idx ], N1 … N events

]

static get_per_hitobject_score_data(score_data_array)¶
static get_percent_below_offset(per_hitobject_score_data, hitobject_idx, offset)¶
static solve_for_hit_offset(per_hitobject_score_data, hitobject_idx, target_percent)¶

Solves for the tapping offset for the note that 50% of players are able to do

Gives the percent of players tapping within the specified offset for each hitobject

static trans_solve_for_hit_offset(per_hitobject_score_data)¶

Solves for the tapping offset for the note that 50% of players are able to do
